scenarioDescription:
The HIP 91258 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 91258 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.89 times its radius. It is located 149.66 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HIP 91258 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 91258 system


HIP 91258 b

HIP 91258 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2014-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 91258 b is 346.620 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HIP 91258 b is 13.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 91258 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 91258, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HIP 91258 - System With 1 Exoplanet
